welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content:
# Collection

Utility data structure used in Discord.js.

classes.name: Collection
classes.description: A Map with additional utility methods. This is used throughout discord.js rather than Arrays for anything that has an ID, for significantly improved performance and ease-of-use.

props.name: _array
props.description: Cached array for the array() method - will be reset to null whenever set() or delete() are called

props.name: _keyArray
props.description: Cached array for the keyArray() method - will be reset to null whenever set() or delete() are called

methods.name: get
methods.description: Identical to Map.get(). Gets an element with the specified key, and returns its value, or undefined if the element does not exist.

params.name: key
params.description: The key to get from this collection

methods.name: set
methods.description: Identical to Map.set(). Sets a new element in the collection with the specified key and value.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the element to add

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the element to add

methods.name: has
methods.description: Identical to Map.has(). Checks if an element exists in the collection.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the element to check for

returns.description: true if the element exists, false if it does not exist.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Identical to Map.delete(). Deletes an element from the collection.

params.name: key
params.description: The key to delete from the collection

returns.description: true if the element was removed, false if the element does not exist.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Identical to Map.clear(). Removes all elements from the collection.

methods.name: array
methods.description: Creates an ordered array of the values of this collection, and caches it internally. The array will only be reconstructed if an item is added to or removed from the collection, or if you change the length of the array itself. If you don't want this caching behavior, use [...collection.values()] or Array.from(collection.values()) instead.

methods.name: keyArray
methods.description: Creates an ordered array of the keys of this collection, and caches it internally. The array will only be reconstructed if an item is added to or removed from the collection, or if you change the length of the array itself. If you don't want this caching behavior, use [...collection.keys()] or Array.from(collection.keys()) instead.

methods.name: first
methods.description: Obtains the first value(s) in this collection.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount of values to obtain from the beginning

returns.description: A single value if no amount is provided or an array of values, starting from the end if amount is negative

methods.name: firstKey
methods.description: Obtains the first key(s) in this collection.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount of keys to obtain from the beginning

returns.description: A single key if no amount is provided or an array of keys, starting from the end if amount is negative

methods.name: last
methods.description: Obtains the last value(s) in this collection. This relies on {@link Collection#array}, and thus the caching mechanism applies here as well.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount of values to obtain from the end

returns.description: A single value if no amount is provided or an array of values, starting from the start if amount is negative

methods.name: lastKey
methods.description: Obtains the last key(s) in this collection. This relies on {@link Collection#keyArray}, and thus the caching mechanism applies here as well.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount of keys to obtain from the end

returns.description: A single key if no amount is provided or an array of keys, starting from the start if amount is negative

methods.name: random
methods.description: Obtains unique random value(s) from this collection. This relies on {@link Collection#array}, and thus the caching mechanism applies here as well.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount of values to obtain randomly

returns.description: A single value if no amount is provided or an array of values

methods.name: randomKey
methods.description: Obtains unique random key(s) from this collection. This relies on {@link Collection#keyArray}, and thus the caching mechanism applies here as well.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount of keys to obtain randomly

returns.description: A single key if no amount is provided or an array

methods.name: find
methods.description: Searches for a single item where the given function returns a truthy value. This behaves like Array.find(). All collections used in Discord.js are mapped using their id property, and if you want to find by id you should use the get method. See MDN for details.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to test with (should return boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing function

methods.name: findKey
methods.description: Searches for the key of a single item where the given function returns a truthy value. This behaves like Array.findIndex(), but returns the key rather than the positional index.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to test with (should return boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing function

methods.name: sweep
methods.description: Removes items that satisfy the provided filter function.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing function

methods.name: filter
methods.description: Identical to Array.filter(), but returns a Collection instead of an Array.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to test with (should return boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing function

methods.name: partition
methods.description: Partitions the collection into two collections where the first collection contains the items that passed and the second contains the items that failed.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing function

methods.name: flatMap
methods.description: Maps each item into a Collection, then joins the results into a single Collection. Identical in behavior to Array.flatMap().

params.name: fn
params.description: Function that produces a new Collection

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing function

methods.name: map
methods.description: Maps each item to another value into an array. Identical in behavior to Array.map().

params.name: fn
params.description: Function that produces an element of the new array, taking three arguments

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing function

methods.name: mapValues
methods.description: Maps each item to another value into a collection. Identical in behavior to Array.map().

params.name: fn
params.description: Function that produces an element of the new collection, taking three arguments

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing function

methods.name: some
methods.description: Checks if there exists an item that passes a test. Identical in behavior to Array.some().

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing function

methods.name: every
methods.description: Checks if all items passes a test. Identical in behavior to Array.every().

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing function

methods.name: reduce
methods.description: Applies a function to produce a single value. Identical in behavior to Array.reduce().

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to reduce, taking four arguments; accumulator, currentValue, currentKey, and collection

params.name: initialValue
params.description: Starting value for the accumulator

methods.name: each
methods.description: Identical to Map.forEach(), but returns the collection instead of undefined.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to execute for each element

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing function

methods.name: tap
methods.description: Runs a function on the collection and returns the collection.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to execute

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing function

methods.name: clone
methods.description: Creates an identical shallow copy of this collection.

methods.name: concat
methods.description: Combines this collection with others into a new collection. None of the source collections are modified.

params.name: collections
params.description: Collections to merge

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Checks if this collection shares identical items with another. This is different to checking for equality using equal-signs, because the collections may be different objects, but contain the same data.

params.name: collection
params.description: Collection to compare with

methods.name: sort
methods.description: The sort method sorts the items of a collection in place and returns it. The sort is not necessarily stable in Node 10 or older. The default sort order is according to string Unicode code points.

params.name: compareFunction
params.description: Specifies a function that defines the sort order. If omitted, the collection is sorted according to each character's Unicode code point value, according to the string conversion of each element.

methods.name: intersect
methods.description: The intersect method returns a new structure containing items where the keys are present in both original structures.

params.name: other
params.description: The other Collection to filter against

methods.name: difference
methods.description: The difference method returns a new structure containing items where the key is present in one of the original structures but not the other.

params.name: other
params.description: The other Collection to filter against

methods.name: sorted
methods.description: The sorted method sorts the items of a collection and returns it. The sort is not necessarily stable in Node 10 or older. The default sort order is according to string Unicode code points.

params.name: compareFunction
params.description: Specifies a function that defines the sort order. If omitted, the collection is sorted according to each character's Unicode code point value, according to the string conversion of each element.
